casebody.data:
Townshend v. McGuire et al. (Superior Court of New York City, General Term. July 8, 1890.) Exceptions from jury term. Action in ejectment by John Townshend against Catherine J. McGuire and others. A verdict was directed for defendants, and plaintiff’s exceptions were ordered to he heard in the first instance at general term.

Argued before Truax and Ingraham, JJ.

John Townshend, plaintiff, in pro. per. John C. Shaw, for defendants. Per Curiam.

The exceptions taken by plaintiff are overruled, and judgment is ordered for the defendants on the verdict, on the authority of Townshend v. Frommer, 5 N. Y. Supp. 442, with costs.
